articles.author: Jack Kim, Ju-Min Park
articles.description: President Yoon Suk Yeol declared martial law on Tuesday night, creating the most serious challenge to South Korea's democracy since the 1980s as lawmakers rejected the move in a vote and protesters gathered outside parliament.
articles.title: South Korea parliament rejects president's martial law declaration

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: France is at a turning point due to uncertainty over the country's budget and the future of the government, Finance Minister Antoine Armand said on Tuesday.
articles.title: France at turning point amid budget uncertainty, finance minister says

articles.author: Nyasha Nyaungwa
articles.description: Netumbo Nandi-Ndaitwah of Namibia's ruling SWAPO party has been elected president and will be the country's first female leader, results released by the country's electoral commission showed on Tuesday.
articles.title: Namibia elects Nandi-Ndaitwah as first female president

articles.author: Maya Gebeily, Suleiman Al-Khalidi
articles.description: Syrian rebels advancing against government forces pushed close on Tuesday to the major city of Hama, rebels and a war monitor said, after their sudden capture of Aleppo last week rocked President Bashar al-Assad.
articles.title: Syrian rebels advance close to Hama city, raising pressure on Assad and his allies

articles.author: Sarah Young
articles.description: King Charles and Keir Starmer welcomed Qatar's emir, Sheikh Tamim bin Hamad Al Thani, for a state visit to Britain on Tuesday that the prime minister hopes will help build on the Gulf state's investment in the country.
articles.title: King Charles welcomes Qatar's emir as state visit begins

articles.author: Andrew Gray, Lili Bayer
articles.description: Ukraine declared it would not settle for anything less than NATO membership to guarantee its future security, as the alliance sidestepped Kyiv's call for an immediate invitation at a foreign ministers' meeting on Tuesday.
articles.title: Ukraine pushes NATO membership as allies sidestep invite call

articles.author: Josh Smith
articles.description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol's shocking late-night declaration of martial law brought years of clashes with domestic opponents, the media and even his own conservative party to a head and threw his political future into doubt.
articles.title: South Korean president's failed attempt at martial law may put his position in peril

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Koreans were shocked on Tuesday when President Yoon Suk Yeol said in an unannounced live TV broadcast that he was declaring martial law - then reversed course just hours later.
articles.title: Explainer: What we know about South Korea's martial law declaration

articles.author: Anthony Deutsch
articles.description: Russian presidential aircraft and funds were used in a program that took children from occupied Ukrainian territories, stripped them of Ukrainian identity and placed them with Russian families, according to a report by Yale's School of Public Health.
articles.title: Putin-controlled aircraft deported Ukrainian children, U.S.-backed research alleges

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Fighting resumed in eastern Congo on Monday, again violating a ceasefire, the M23 rebel group and Congolese army said, casting doubt on whether the M23 group will cease its offensive after the withdrawal of Rwandan troops.
articles.title: Fighting resumes in eastern Congo, army and M23 say
